description.narrative: Improved specific energy consumption and reduced GHG emissions in the public buildings sector of FSM.

participating-org.narrative: FSM Dept. Of Resources and Dev

condition.narrative: Social and environmental sustainability will be enhanced through application of the UNDP Social and Environmental Standards (http://www.undp.org/ses) and related Accountability Mechanism (http://www.undp.org/secu-srm).

description.narrative:
1) Project Goal: Improved specific energy consumption and reduced GHG emissions in the buildings sector of the country. i) Specific energy consumption in the buildings sector, kWh/m2/yr. ii) Cumulative incremental GHG emission reduction from the buildings sector, tons CO2e.
2) Project Objective: Improved application of energy conserving and energy efficient techniques and practices in the design, retrofit, operation & maintenance of public sector buildings. i) Cumulative incremental fossil fuel savings due to sustainable energy efficiency and low carbon interventions implemented, toe diesel. ii) No. of new jobs created in the application of EC&EE technologies and techniques in the country’s building sector.
3) Outcome 1/ATLAS Activity 1: i) Number of approved and followed building EC&EE policies, and associated guidance and implementing rules and regulations. ii) Number of public sector buildings that are compliant to energy standards stipulated in building EC&EE policies, and associated guidance and implementing rules and regulations.
4) Outcome 2/ATLAS Activity 2: i) Number of buildings reviewed under established and operational energy audit system for comprehensive best commercially available EE equipment EE demos and replication renovations. ii) Number of state/national level quarterly reports on public sector buildings energy use from state power utilities and consumption reports. iii) Number of building/sectoral level ISO50001 style annual reports submitted to the FSM Energy Group.
5) Outcome 3/ATLAS Activity 3: i) Number of public sector building EE technology application projects designed and financed for implementation as demonstrations. ii) Number of EC&EE projects implemented in public sector buildings influenced by the results and outcomes of the implemented technology application demonstrations.
6) Outcome 4/ATLAS Activity 4: i) Number of trained public sector building personnel that can ably manage the design, implement and evaluate of building E

comment.narrative:
1) Project Goal: i) 150 ii) 0

4) Outcome 2/ATLAS Activity 2: i) 0 ii) 0 iii) 0

Outcome 1/ATLAS Activity 1: i) An updated Gender Survey, and a complete Environmental & Social Impact Assessment (ESIA), and an endorsed Environmental & Social Management Plan (ESMP). ii) Literature review on EC&EE policies and regulations for the buildings sector in developed countries and in small island developing states (SIDS). iii) Evaluation of buildings sector EC&EE policies and regulations from selected countries. iv) Inventory of local (i.e., state and national) EC&EE policies and regulations for the buildings sector in FSM. v) Comparative analysis of local and EC&EE policies and regulations for the buildings sector, and those public sector buildings. vi) Formulation of recommended EC&EE policies on EC&EE practices and applications in the public sector buildings. vii) Workshop on the building EC&EE policies and regulations, particularly in public sector buildings. viii) Publication and dissemination of the results of the EC&EE policy research work and the proposed policies and regulations on the practice and application of EC&EE for adoption in the buildings sector (particularly public sector buildings) in FSM.
Outcome 2/ATLAS Activity 2: i) Review of building energy audit practices and needs. ii) Development of a public sector Building Energy Audit System (BEAS).
Project management/ATLAS Activity 5: i) An established project management unit, including key project management staff. ii) An Induction Training and Inception Workshop, and a completed Inception Report. (ii) Completed quarterly and monitoring reports. (iii) Reports of Technical Working Group meetings, and Project Board Meeting. (iv) 2022 Annual Work Plan.

1) Endorsed MPSBEE project document and Social and Environmental Screening Procedure (SESP).
2) Project management/ATLAS Activity 5: An established project management unit, including key project management staff with an induction training convened.
